newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan State Oil rises 1.05 percent.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan State Oil rises 1.05 percent.

text.p: State-run Pakistan State Oil rose 3.00 rupees, or 1.05 percent, to 289 on Friday on fresh buying by long-term investors, dealers said.
They said PSO was attracting renewed interest because its 10-rupee scrip had fallen to an attractive level from a high of 325 last month on bearish sentiment.
Some 14,800 shares changed hands in early trade at the Karachi Stock Exchange, one dealer said.

The stock rose to 325 after the company announced its results for the first half ended December 31, showing that after-tax profits rose 58 percent to 869 million rupees from 548 million in the year-earlier period.
